column4: can someone please take a look at the tail end of the "make" output and tell me what I'm missing?  http://pastebin.ca/516711
depending on whether that's a Qt3 or Qt4 program, i suppose you might want to try installing one of those.
installing those packages didn't work... I thought maybe assigning QTDIR to /usr/lib/qt3 may have caued this problem, but I couldn't find any qt4 directory
locate qpixmap.h after installing those packages didn't turn anything up either
the locate database is updated daily, not in real time
try "dpkg -L <packagename>" to see where the files ended up
those headers probably ended up in /usr/include/qt4 then... I should redo ./configure with that location for QTDIR?
possibly, do you positively know it's qt4 that the program wants though?
but nothing else is working ... it's pdfedit, btw
then find out first, before wasting more time. README or INSTALL should definitely mention that
I read both, it doesn't mention which version of QT they want.... and I just tried redoing ./configure w/ the new directory... make still didn't work
actually no, I reread it, and it says qt3
but I made sure I had all of what they said to have
all the libraries and headers for qt3, boost and xlib

you could try installing "kde-devel", that's about the most comprehensive KDE/Qt related package. but there might actually be an issue in the autoconf, seeing http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=340011 and http://pdfedit.petricek.net/bt/view.php?id=146
I played around with it a bit, setting QTDIR again with the 'make' command...and it seems to be doing something
